plugins.name: Figmaster
plugins.description:
The world's first design systems workbook for Figma


Learn how to build your design system from scratch by doing exercises in Figma


Visit the official website to learn more


What is Figmaster?

In short, the Figmaster plugin is a workbook for Figma that contains a large set of exercises on how to build your modern design system from scratch.


How does it work?

By doing exercises in Figma, you learn and create your guide style and component library simultaneously. It is a format that will help you get the most out of each lesson. By learning - you create, and by the way, you get to know keyboard shortcuts, plugins, and techniques of working in Figma that will speed up your workflow. Everything happens in Figma - no distractions.


Course description

Design Systems are becoming so popular because they make products more consistent, accessible, improve their usability, and reduce design decision-making.

Nowadays, companies and individuals need to learn how to design advanced components, style guides, and documentation in Figma. Improving the workflow and onboarding the new designers to the team is also a challenge.

In Figmaster, you will learn how to create a design system from scratch in Figma. The Figmaster is purely and simply about practice, so you can start using acquired knowledge right away.

In this course, you will learn how to set up all the needed design tokens, such as defining proper grids, layouts, spacing, managing icons, choosing and creating color and typographic scales. You will also learn how to make the components like buttons, inputs, modals, text areas, checkboxes, notifications, radio buttons… You will learn how to name components correctly using naming conventions and translate your components into variants. You will also learn how to improve your workflow by using handy keyboard shortcuts, plugins, and tricks. At the end of this course, you will create your own complete Design System and apply it anywhere with confidence.

In the team version, you will learn how to work on a design system in a team and how to onboard new designers with the Figmaster. I will also share resources so you can learn more about design systems theory and get inspiration from the existing systems.

We will use the full potential of Figma, making our Design System with variants, auto layout, and the latest Figma feature: interactive components. 🎉

So if you want to learn how to create a Design System from scratch in Figma, this is for you.


Module 1. Style Guide

In the first module, we'll create design tokens and convert them into Figma Styles. We'll prepare the icon library for the entire system. We'll also set up some spacing rules that we'll follow in the next modules.


Module 2. Components

In the second module, we'll use the Styles, icons, and rules from the previous module to create the components.


Module 3. Documentation

In the third module, we'll create documentation components and frames. Then, we'll document our components and styles. In this module, you'll also learn how to make your components interactive.


Module 4. Use it

In the fourth module, we'll build a simple UI with our design system. I'll also show you how to customize it for your needs. That is, change the colors, typography, or component properties to match your product or brand requirements.


Module 5. Team license bonus

In the last module, I'll show you how to work with a design system we created in a team. You'll also learn how to onboard new designers to the library. As a bonus, you'll also get access to additional resources on design systems, such as links, articles, book recommendations, etc.

accepted.name: Matt Wierzbicki
accepted.description: Product designer and entrepreneur running multiple projects.

plugins.tagline: The world's first design systems workbook for Figma

plugins.name: Import to Phase
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma designs into interactive, production-ready prototypes with Phase

• Create animations and interactions that actually ship to production

• Export as React components - no more design-to-code translation issues (Beta Release)

• Enable multiple simultaneous interactions (impossible in Figma alone)

• Work seamlessly between Figma and Phase with automatically organized interactions

• Professional animation tools: keyframes, motion paths, easing curves, and animation presets

• Real-time collaboration with developers and stakeholders


Join thousands of designers who bridge the gap between design and development! 🚀


Getting started is incredibly simple:

1 Select your design - Choose frames, components, or groups to export

2 Click Import - Phase allows you to choose to turn your variants into interactions (Please note that nested components are not yet supported due to Figma's flattened component system, but we're working on it! :-)

3 Open in Phase - Your designs are ready with interactions converted to Actions

4 Enhance & Export - Add animations and export as code or media files


If you like learning with videos, checkout our demo: https://youtu.be/dn8JnLu-KqI


Features

🎯 Design to Code, Seamlessly

Unlike other prototyping tools, Phase exports your animations and interactions as production-ready React components. What you design is what gets built.

⚡ Multiple Simultaneous Interactions

Break free from Figma's limitations. Run multiple animations and interactions at the same time - just like in real applications.

🎨 Professional Animation Control

• Keyframes - Precise control over every animation property

• Path Animations - Motion paths for curved movements, trim paths for draw-on effects, and path morphing for shape transformations

• Animation Presets - ready-to-use animation effects (fade, scale, spin, trim, and more)

• Advanced Easing - Bezier curves, elastic, bounce, and custom easing


🔄 Import your Figma Interactions

You can choose to convert your Interactive components from Figma to Phase Actions.

🚀 Export Options That Matter

• React Components - Production-ready code

• Lottie - Lightweight animations for web and mobile

• Video/GIF - For presentations and social media

• dotLottie - Compressed animations with smaller file sizes


👥 Built for Teams

• Real-time collaboration with multi-cursor support

• Version history and commenting

• Share prototypes with stakeholders instantly


What makes Phase different?

From Design to Development

While other tools stop at visual prototypes, Phase generates actual code. Your beautiful interactions become real features, not just demos.

True Interactivity

Create conditional logic, decision-based flows, and complex user journeys. Phase combines visual design with programming logic.

Developer-Friendly

No more "lost in translation" between design and development. Developers receive clean, organized React components they can actually use.


Current Limitations

We believe in transparency. Here's what to expect:

• Borders become centered in Phase

• Text underlines and emojis aren't supported yet

• Blur/shadow effects may appear differently

• Polygons convert to paths

• Code export doesn’t support booleans and some animations yet because translating the canvas into code is really hard.. we’re working on it and shipping fast!

•We can’t yet support importing nested components because Figma’s flattened design system is not compatible, we’re figuring out a workaround!


These limitations are temporary as we continuously improve the plugin.


FAQ

Can I use Phase without coding knowledge?

Absolutely! Phase is designed for designers. The code export is a bonus for developer handoff, but you never need to write code yourself.

What happens to my Figma interactions?

They're automatically converted to Phase Actions, ready for enhancement with advanced animations.

Can I collaborate with my team?

Yes! Phase supports real-time collaboration, commenting, and version history. Share via restricted links, remix links, or prototype-only links.

What export formats are supported?

• Code: React components with CSS & JavaScript (Beta Release)

• Animation: GIF, MP4, Lottie (.json), dotLottie (.lottie)

• All exports maintain your animation timing and interactions

Is it free to try?

Yes! Phase is free to use.


We're here to help you succeed:

📧 Email: support@phase.com

💬 Community: Join our community: https://community.phase.com/c/questions/


⠀

Ready to ship real interactions? Import your designs to Phase and bridge the gap between design and development today! ✨
plugins.tagline: Design in Figma, Prototype in Phase

plugins.name: Reattach Instance
plugins.description:
Relink a frame to a component by searching for similar instances.

---

Use cases:
• Copying a nested component
• Moving the master component to a different file
• Turning a set of similar frames into a component
• Turning detached instances back into instances

---

How it works:
 1. Select frames (that used to be instances)
 2. Click "Plugin/Reattach instance"
 3. Plugin finds instances or master components with the same name
 4. New instance is created for each corresponding frame
 5. The selected frames are replaced by instances 🎉

👉 NEW: Overrides will now be applied to instances!

---

Known problems:
• Relies too much on layer naming
• Needs to have an instance/master as a reference on the same file
• Doesn't work all the time with team libraries

Feel free to contribute 😅
https://github.com/renancamm/figma-reattache-instance

plugins.name: Mock
plugins.description:
Quickly and easily fill text fields with customizable sample content.


Mock allows you to choose an intelligent grouping of the selected fields, so you don't have to waste time selecting them one by one. Select anything - an entire mockup, a frame, a set of fields - and Mock will let you choose which group to paste into.


You can paste from predefined data like names, addresses, numbers, and dates - or find or create your own lists online and link to those from inside the plugin.

plugins.name: Icon Master
plugins.description:
Why Icon Master?

While working with icons, the most annoying thing is different sizes of icons. It becomes more painful, when we have to use icons from third party library. Then resizing icons and creating icon components become a hard task. Here Icon Master comes to assist us.


Features

  • We can resize icons
  • We can add containers around icons
  • Icon will be automatically converted into components
  • We can change colors of the new icons
  • Many more useful features are coming...


How to use?

It's as simple as a snap. What you have to do is:

  • Just select one or more frames or vector nodes
  • Run the Icon Master plugin
  • Provide expected container and icon sizes as well as color of icon
  • And Boom... (Click the boom button)
  • A new frame with new icons will be generated


Your help needed

This plugin may have several errors or lack of features. In that case we need your help.

If you face any issue, please, kindly report that in the comment section.

Also if you have any feature request, please, tell us more about it. We'll definitely try to implement (if the feature is useful).


You can meet me here: https://www.showrin.com/

accepted.name: Showrin Barua
accepted.description: A Javascript developer who loves to build unique things for the web and spread knowledge by writings.

plugins.name: Make Filled
plugins.description:
Fill shapes and include the original outline


  1. Fill outlined vector shapes and include the original outline
  2. Useful for icons that have both an outlined and a filled style
  3. Works with rectangles, ellipses, polygons, stars, closed vector shapes, and boolean operation groups
  4. Select groups, frames, and boolean operation groups to fill every compatible shape inside
  5. Original stroke colour will be applied as the fill colour of the final shape


  1. Create a boolean operation group that includes the stroke and the fill using the “Make Filled” command
  2. Create a flattened version of the final shape using the “Make Filled and Flatten” command
  3. Merge multiple shapes into a single vector layer using the “Make Filled and Merge” command


Notes


This plugin ignores invisible layers.


Do you have a feature request? Let me know on GitHub or Mastodon :)


This plugin is open source on GitHub


Made by @johjakob

accepted.name: Johannes Jakob
accepted.description: Designer and Artist

plugins.tagline: Fill shapes and include the original outline

plugins.name: Font Switcher
plugins.description:
Switch the font family from the quick actions and keep the font weight.


The font weight will be retained if the new font family has that weight.


How to:

  1. Select some nodes with texts (Text, Sticky, Connector, Shapes with text, etc.)
  2. Open quick action (Win: Ctrl+/ or Ctrl+P) - (Mac: Cmd + / or Cmd + P)
  3. Type "Font switcher" and press Tab
  4. Reach your font and press "Enter"

plugins.name: Face Dummy
plugins.description:
All images provided by this plugin are royalty-free, so you don't have to worry about copyright issues anymore!

Say goodbye to the hassle of searching for profile images during UI design. :)


Simple Instructions

  1. Select one or more shape layers where you wish to apply the profile image.
  2. Click on an image or the "Insert Randomly" button in the plugin window to apply.

*The maximum resolution per image is 240px, which is more than adequate for mockup creation.


Free Version

  1. Maximum resolution is limited to 100px.
  2. You can use 4 images per theme.
  3. Best suited for non-commercial use and quick mockups.


Pro Version

  1. Unlimited access to all dummy images across all themes.
  2. High-resolution support up to 600px.
  3. Includes commercial use rights and continuous updates.
  4. One-time payment — lifetime access guaranteed.


Start free with limited images.

Go Pro for full access and 600px quality — one-time payment, lifetime use.


Do you have any feedback?


If you have any inquiries, feel free to contact us anytime at designbasekorea@gmail.com.


Website: https://designbase.co.kr/

YouTube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/designbase

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/designbasekorea/


© 2024 DesignBase. All rights reserved

plugins.name: Crop and Flatten as Image
plugins.description:
This plugin will convert each selected node to a flattened, rasterized image that is cropped to its actual size. This is ideal for pre-processing slides before exporting as PDF, as you can dramatically reduce the file size by cropping large fills and flattening layers of images and gradients into a single image. It is a simple image optimization & compression technique that can be combined with post-processing the PDF for much smaller files.


Choose PNG if you are flattening images that require transparency, otherwise JPG (it will default to a white background).


Note: This is a destructive action, so it is best to do it on a copy.

accepted.name: Matt DesLauriers
accepted.description: Generative Artist & Creative Coder

plugins.tagline: convert a group to a single cropped and flattened image, for optimization

plugins.name: Penpot Exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin can convert a Figma file into a Penpot compatible format. This will generate a .zip file that you can import into Penpot. The plugin is Open Source, just like Penpot, and you can see its development in our Github and see its Roadmap.


What can this plugin currently import?

Most of the Figma features supported on Penpot are already being exported by the plugin:


  1. Basic shapes (Rectangles, Ellipses, Stars and Polygons)
  2. Vectors, Lines and Arrows
  3. Frames and Sections (Boards in Penpot)
  4. Groups and Boolean groups
  5. Masks
  6. Texts (you can upload your own fonts too)
  7. All basic shapes properties (fills, visibility, strokes, corner radius, shadows, rotations, effects, etc...)
  8. Components and Components Sets
  9. Component instances
  10. Auto Layouts
  11. Color and Typography libraries


How to use the plug-in

Do you have doubts about how to use the plug-in? Visit the Wiki, where you’ll find different step-by-step guides, including:

  1. How to export/import files from Figma to Penpot
  2. How to export custom fonts
  3. How to export design systems (libraries)


Exportation time

Please note that the exportation time may vary depending on the size of the file and the specs of your computer. Larger files may take a bit longer to process. So, why not take a well deserved coffee break while your file gets ready to be enjoyed in Penpot? ☕ We are continuously optimizing the plugin to ensure a smooth and efficient experience. Your patience is appreciated, and we’re excited for you to try it.


For the best experience we recommend using the Figma Desktop App to do the export of large files.


Want to test the plug-in with sample files first?

Before using the plug-in with your own files, you can try it out with these community files:

  1. Small File: Android App Icons - Ideal for trying the exportation of a larger file. ⏱️ Export time around: 1 minute
  2. Larger File: Android UI Kit - Ideal for trying the exportation of a larger file. ⏱️ Export time around: 20 minute


Reporting Issues

Please read our guide on how to report issues:

  1. How to report an Issue


License

License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.

plugins.name: typeff
plugins.description:
TypEff is a typing effect plugin that enables users to create dynamic text animations within their Figma designs. It provides three options: typing, deleting, and looping.


With the typing option, users can simulate the effect of text being typed out character by character, creating an animated typing effect. The plugin allows users to customize the typing speed, font, and other properties to achieve the desired effect.


The deleting option allows users to simulate the effect of text being erased character by character, mimicking the backspace or delete action. This can be useful for creating dynamic and interactive text animations within Figma designs.


The looping option allows users to continuously repeat the typing and deleting animation, creating an ongoing loop effect. This can be particularly handy for creating eye-catching and attention-grabbing text-based animations or prototypes.


Overall, this Figma plugin offers a convenient way to add dynamic typing effects to text elements in Figma, enhancing the visual appeal and interactivity of designs.

accepted.name: Ayyoub Essadeq
accepted.description: I am an ambitious software engineer passionate about open source projects. Skilled and dedicated, I thoroughly enjoy my work.

plugins.tagline: typeff enables users to automatically create typing effect animation.

plugins.name: Commentor
plugins.description:
Write the comments and explanations to your design in the Figma.

Buy me a coffee ☕


How to use the plugin:

  • Select the layer;
  • Enter the comment number (optional) and text;
  • Select the color of the label (red by default);
  • Choose whether or not to show the author of the comment;
  • Click «Create Comment»


The plugin will automatically create a new frame with a comment next to the selected frame. Each comment will try to align against the selected layer.


Update Positions

If the coordinates of the layers associated with the comments have been changed, then the comments and labels will try to align next to it. This will work for the frames you have selected or for every frame on the page if you have not selected anything. This function is automatically called when a new comment is created.


Show/Hide Labels

Show or hide labels inside frames.


Remove unused labels

If you deleted a comment and want to remove unused label, use this function.


Limitations in the plugin:

- Plugin works on a single selected layer;

- The label field is optional and must be a number in the range 0 to 99;

- Functions "Show/Hide labels" and "Remove unused labels" work for all the frames on the page.
plugins.tagline: Write the comments and explanations to your design in the Figma

plugins.name: illustrator.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Import Adobe Illustrator files (.ai) to Figma
plugins.description:
Import your Adobe Illustrator files as fully editable Figma designs.

Go directly from Illustrator to Figma and convert your .ai artboards into Figma layers!


How to import Adobe Illustrator files into Figma:

  1. Run this Figma plugin, illustrator.to.design
  2. Upload your .ai file, or drag-and-drop it into the plugin
  3. Click “Import”
  4. Your Illustrator artboard will be imported into Figma as fully-editable layers or high-res images!


Why use illustrator.to.design?

  1. Go directly from Illustrator to Figma - no additional converter tools required.
  2. Fast, high-quality conversion from Adobe Illustrator .ai to Figma to keep your designs precise.
  3. Perfect for migrating between tools or using old files for new designs!


FREE

PRO License

plugins.name: Status ✅
plugins.description:
When collaborating on features with multiple designers and developers, it can be hard to keep track of which designs are ready to be implemented and what is still a work in progress.

Status for Figma brings order to the chaos by providing a simple way to mark the status of a design. Simple right-click on your frame, go to Plugins, Status, and select your desired status.

Some tips:
- You can select multiple frames at once. Each frame will get its own status badge.
- Use the keyboard shortcut to quickly set a status: hit `cmd /` in Mac and `ctrl /` on Windows, type a Status (e.g. “Done”) and hit return.
- Status for Figma is not limited to frames. It works with any object you can select.
- You can optionally automatically group the selected element and status badge, so they can be moved around easily (see the plugin settings)

Status for Figma is open source. Feel free to contribute or to send suggestions. https://github.com/bramschulting/status-for-figma

plugins.name: Instance Utils
plugins.description:
Gives you ultimate control over nested instances, tweak ◇s around without detaching.


👉 Video Tutorial


Major Update Highlights:


Tuesday, Dec, 26th, 2023

  1. Major speed optimizations.
  2. Added the full "integrated slot" workflow.
  3. Updated UI to include a setting page, as well as slot creation and slot consumption pages.


Monday, Aug, 8th, 2022

  1. Added back Table (row based) control function
  2. ^Works on all table instances as long as its direct children are ◇rows, and the direct children of each ◇row are ◇cells.
  3. If the table contain a table header, make sure the name of the header row includes letter 'h'


Thursday, May, 26th, 2022

  1. Brought back the seamless slot edit functionality, and made it more bug-prove, also changed the matching rule to ◇'s ❖ name must include 'slot'(case insensitive).


Sunday, May, 22th, 2022

  1. Added the ability to assimilate nearby instance by pressing the directional arrow button while holding ⌥


Saturday, May, 21th, 2022

  1. Rewrote the whole plugin using React
  2. Fixed all known bugs
  3. Reworked algorithms
  4. Supports multi-copy and multi-paste
  5. Supports Dark mode


Monday, September 27th, 2021

  1. Added support for ".slot" naming


Sunday, September 26th, 2021

  1. Added the ability to Swap the main components on 2 instances only, triggered by clicking on the arrow button while holding down ⌥(alt) key

  1. Added Mutual variants
  2. Added ability to paste Component only

  1. Added Seamless workflow with ◇Slot


Thursday, August 5th, 2021

  1. Now the pasted instance will take on the former instances' auto layout attributes

  1. Copy is now stored in the plugin, you can close the plugin without losing your last copy.
  2. Minor UX improvements
  3. Added support for setting up "Table (Row Based)"


Tuesday, March 29th, 2021

  1. Added the ability to quickly assimilate adjacent instance, triggered by clicking on the arrow button while holding down ⌥(alt) key


Tuesday, March 9th, 2021

  1. Added the ability to edit a instance in place (locally)
  2. Fixed some layer's visibility issue.


Thursday, February 16th, 2021

  1. Addressed an edge case where missing fonts could cause fatal runtime errors
  2. Addressed an edge case where hidden layers could cause unbelievable slowness

Thursday, February 11th, 2021

  1. Rewrote the algorithm, 5x overall performance improvement on average, and up to 20x more responsive.
  2. Fixed a bug where the auto-layout resizing mode and paddings would not be transferred. Now everything works as expected.


Feature Roadmaps:

  1. Finer control over which property to be transfered.

plugins.name: Icon Set Generator
plugins.description:
Simple figma plugin to generate component variants for icons.


Plugin capabilities:

  • Batch generation of icon component variant sets or creation of a single icon variants.
  • Preservation of nested overrides when swapping icons on UI components by merging nested vectors.
  • Removal of transparent bound layers and groups to optimize the generated icons.
  • Automatic application of local style for the created icon set.
  • Automatic tokenization of the component name following the naming convention $icon-name.
  • Customizable stroke settings for each size.


How to use:

  1. Select one or multiple icon frames.
  2. Specify the desired size variants.
  3. Optionally, choose a local color style or set custom strokes for line icons.
  4. Click on the "Generate" button.

plugins.name: Offset Resizer
plugins.description:
Offset frames, components and component sets by a uniform distance from their contents.


Offset Resizer is for when you have a frame you want to “Resize to fit”, but you also need a margin. It works on frames, components and component sets.


NEW – We've added an option to set the left & right margin independently


How to run Offset Resizer


Offset Resizer is keyboard operated.


→ Select the frame (or frames) you want to resize.

→ Type ⌘ + / to open Figma’s quick actions search bar (or Ctrl + / if you are on Windows).

→ Type “Offset” to search for and run the plugin.

→ Enter the offset you want to apply, or select one of the preset values.

→ Hit Enter to run the plugin, or Tab to enter a separate left & right margin.


_


Many thanks to Nick Qurle for his help on the latest update.

plugins.name: Link to Documentation
plugins.description:
Open documentation pages from your components.

—————————————————————————————————
How to use:

Add Link:
1. Select a layer/component and run Link to Documentation > Add Link.
2. Enter a URL to your documentation page.
3. Optionally, you can check "Add 📖  emoji to layer name" so it will be easier to tell which layers have documentations links.
4. Click "Add Link".

If you are adding a link to a component, it is recommended to add it to the master component so all its instances will have access to the same link.

If you are adding a link to a team library component, make sure to publish an update of the library so other files using this component will have access to the link as well.

Remove Link:
1. Select a layer/component and run Link to Documentation > Remove Link.

View Documentation:
1. Select a layer/component with a documentation link. (See above)
2. Run Link to Documentation > View Documentation.

—————————————————————————————————
Note:
Plugins are currenly not available to users with read-only access to files. To work around this limitation, have your read-only users duplicate the file as a draft and use the plugin on their own copies.

plugins.name: Charts+ (by Highcharts)
plugins.description:
Welcome to the Highcharts Community!


🚀 About Highcharts Core

Highcharts Core is a powerful plugin designed for Figma that allows you to create and adjust charts seamlessly within your design environment.


Key Features:

  1. Comprehensive Chart Support: Instantly generate various chart types including line, bar, gauge, pie, and area charts.
  2. Live Resizing (New!) Charts now automatically resize as you drag the frame — no more re-generating or guesswork.
  3. Figma Slides Support (New!) Insert charts directly into Figma Slides
  4. Effortless Adjustments: Already made a chart? No problem! Update existing charts with just a few clicks to keep them up to date and consistent across your projects.
  5. User-Friendly Interface: Enjoy a simple, intuitive interface that allows you to tweak and fine-tune your charts.
  6. Local Variables for Design Systems: Leverage local variables to create and utilize design systems, allowing you to standardize chart components across different projects and ensure design consistency.
  7. Custom Data for Charts: Now you can import your own custom data directly into the plugin to generate charts. This new feature empowers users to visualize real-world data, offering more flexibility and precision in creating unique, data-driven designs.
  8. Enhanced Data Random Generator: Upgraded the data random generator for more realistic and varied data generation, improving the testing and preview experience.
  9. Collaboration with Developers: Once you've designed your charts, easily send them to developers who can integrate them with our Highcharts library. This streamlined process reduces the time and effort needed to perfect designs, ensuring your visualizations are beautiful and functional in your final product.



📣 Feedback

We are would love your feedback. Share your thoughts, experiences and suggestions in the comments section, or reach out directly via email at figmasupport@highsoft.com. Your input is invaluable and helps us shape the future of Highcharts Core.


🤝 Figma Plugin Development Team

The Highcharts Core Figma plugin was developed by Black Label and Highsoft. Black Label has been the dedicated support and development team for Highcharts and Highsoft for over a decade.


Thank you for being part of our community and helping us build a tool designers love!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create and edit charts in Figma.

This plugin currently leverages iFramely, which takes advantage of open formats like oEmbed, Open Graph, and Structured Data to extract relevant meta information.

18326.name: Web cards
18326.description:
Turn URLs into beautiful cards! Great for collecting inspiration, keeping track of relevant links to projects in a more visual way, or really anything that you would otherwise show a website for.

18326.release_notes:
- Titles are now hyperlinked using the new hyperlinks API!

- You should get slightly better image support than previous versions (I'm trying out a new proxy to avoid CORS image issues)

- I had to remove the favicon and other meta info like price to use a more stable API end point (that also won't charge me money). If you depended on these or other non title / description meta tags, please let me know and I can show you how to run a custom build that will extract it

plugins.name: image.to.design — by ‹div›RIOTS — Imports avif, webp, jpeg XL, jpeg 2000, png, tiff, svg, raw...
plugins.description:
Import any image format into Figma, and optimize memory usage in your document


image.to.design improves the import of formats natively supported by Figma:

  1. Improved SVG compatibility compared to Figma.
  2. PNG images are optimized before import to improve the memory usage and the performance of Figma.
  3. images larger than the normal 4096px limit are imported without resizes
  4. more file formats supported!


Some image formats supported by image.to.design

  1. arw (raw Sony cameras)
  2. avif
  3. bmp
  4. cr2 (raw Canon cameras)
  5. dng (raw Digital Negatives)
  6. gif
  7. heic
  8. heif
  9. jpeg
  10. jpeg XL
  11. jpeg2000
  12. nef
  13. png
  14. svg and svgz
  15. tiff
  16. webp


Let us know what you’d like!

If you’re missing a particular image format or feature, chat with us about it.

plugins.name: Palette From Image
plugins.description:
Want to generate Color Palettes from Images?


This plugin helps you do so, you no longer need to have your image inside your Figma file, you can just select an image from your computer and generate a color palette


What are some awesome features of this plugin ?


(1) Palette from Image does not send your images to a server - it is all generated inside your application


(2) Palette from Image has offline support - you don't need to be online to generate color palettes


(3) Palette from Image gives you access to the color code of each block of color in the palette ( by simply tapping on it)


Want to know more ? Here's a link to the web version with more features ( we plan on adding these features to this plugin with time )


Link below 👇

Color Palette Generator | Color Palette Hub


FAQ 💭


(1) Is Palette From Image secure ?


Yes it is secure - we don't send your images to a server to process them, the plugin can even work offline - all the color extraction and selection happens within the web environment given to me by Figma


(2) Can I use this Palette from Image offline ?


Yes you can use the plugin offline


(3) Can I Export Palette to Image ?


No, you can't for now, but we have a web version that allows that here's a link : Color Palette Generator | Color Palette Hub

plugins.name: Thrshold
plugins.description:
Apply simple Threshold Effect Filter on images. Convert images to alpha masks.


________


1. How does it work ?


• select one (or many) shape with an image fill

• use slider or input to set threshold value

• click on "Apply"


Options :


- Transparent makes the white parts.. transparent

- Alpha masks creates image masks based on lightness


________


2. What is it ?


Thresholding replace each pixel in an image with a black pixel, if the image intensity is less than the threshold value, or a white pixel otherwise.

plugins.name: FigGen - HTML + Tailwind Converter
plugins.description:
Pixel perfect HTML/Tailwind for Figma Auto layout designs.


Features:

  • Utility first approach to generate pixel perfect markup for Figma designs.
  • Built for future, uses flex and respects item spacing
  • No clumsy/frugal code with absolutely positioned elements
  • Uses tailwind 3.0
  • Export assets to zip with a click
  • Handles auto layout and its constraints (better design scalability for both designers and developers)
  • Option to mark exportable assets in your preferred format from Figma itself
  • Handles most common usecases like borders, shadows, background colors, text styles, etc.


Usage:

Figma to code conversion is no rocket science, but for pixel perfect UI, we have to do some pre-processing to unfold the magic. Let’s look at some ways to achieve accurate results:

  • Ensure that the frames have auto layout. It helps us to parse your Design better and also good for scaling designs in long term.
  • Mark the image/icon layers for export in the desirable format. We will import the asset in the selected format for you.
  • Avoid the use of Fixed Height/Width constraints as much as possible. Nearly same results can be achieved using ‘Fill container’/’Hug contents’ constraint.

accepted.name: Ayush Singh
accepted.description:
Senior Frontend Engineer @ Disney+ Hotstar. Previously @ Flipkart
Bridging the gap between engineering and design.
